page.title: 07Local History - Newmarket 1
page.content: Ancient Monument: The Devil's Dyke is a ditch and a bank up to 15 ft. high which stretched straight and unbroken for 7 1/2 miles from the fen edge at Reach to the forest edge at Woodditton. It was probably built in the 5th century but the exact date is not known. There are now gaps in it for roads to go through and during the late war when there was an airfield on the Heath it was found necessary to cut away a section to allow planes to take off and land safely. Rare flowers and butterflies may sometimes be seen. Now it provides a beautiful, peaceful place to walk and many sponsored walks for charity take place there. It also provides a good view of the racing!
